questions.question: The tourists amble along the path. Based on its Latin root, amble means:
Ego dē Olympō ad terram dēscendō. Sum nūntius et deus Rōmānus. Quis sum?
Based on its Latin root, Spain’s Canary Islands had a large number of:
Which woodland deity would a Roman call upon while hunting?
Patrōnus sum. In vīllā prope ātrium labōrō et semper scrībō. Multōs librōs et epistulās habeō. Ubi sum?
Why would you use the Latin abbreviation P.S. (post scriptum) in an email?
options: to add something after the message
to introduce the subject of the message
questions.correct_answer: to add something after the message

questions.question: What did a Roman call multi-level apartment buildings in the city?
When teachers say “Meā culpā,” what are they indicating?
options: It is the end of class.
It is time for partner work.

questions.question: Septem nautae <u>ab Italiā</u> nāvigābant.
Sed <u>hodiē</u> ūnus nauta sōlus est in parvā īnsulā.
Nauta, nōmine Decimus, <u>est</u> perterritus.
Nauta cibum nōn videt <u>et</u> aquam nōn habet.
Ecce! <u>Magna silva</u> est in parvā īnsulā.
<u>Per magnam</u> silvam timidē ambulat.
Nauta puellam in silvā <u>videt.</u>
Decimus rogat, <u>“Quid nōmen est tibi?”</u>
Decimus rogat, “<u>Ubi</u> habitās?”
Tum Decimus rogat, “<u>Habēsne</u> aquam?”
Tiberīna respondet, “<u>Ita vērō.</u> Ego et pater aquam habēmus.”
Decimus dīcit, “<u>Ego</u> et multī nautae ad Graeciam nāvigābāmus.”
